Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which large portions of the country are "corona-free."
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there are still cases of COVID-19 reported in various parts of the country.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that large portions of the country are free from the virus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that improvements in some hotspots equate to large portions of the country being free from the virus, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations and factors that contribute to the decrease in cases in certain areas, such as mitigation measures or changes in testing strategies.
